verses.verse: And when Jesus responded, again He talked to them in illustrations, saying,
"The empire of the heavens is like a person, a king, someone who did wedding events for his son.
And he sent his slaves out on a mission to invite the people who had been invited to the wedding events, and they were not wanting to come.

Again he sent other slaves out, saying, 'Say to the people who have been invited, look, I got my breakfast ready. My bulls, the grain-fed steers (that have been killed), and everything are ready. Come on to the wedding events.'
But the people who did not care went off, the one to his own field, the other to his business.
The rest, after taking hold of his slaves, injured and killed them.
When the king heard, he was enraged. And after he sent his armed forces, he ruined those murderers and incinerated their cities.
Then he says to his slaves, 'Not only is the wedding ready, but the people who had been invited were not deserving.
So travel on the intersections of the roads, and invite however many that you find into the wedding events.'
And when those slaves went out to the roads, they gathered everyone together, as many as they found, both evil and good, and the wedding was full of reclining people.
But when the king came in to view the reclining people, he saw a person there who had not put on the apparel of a wedding.
And he says to him, 'Comrade, how did you come in here not having the apparel of a wedding?' But the person was quiet.

Then the king said to the servants, 'After you tie him up, feet and hands, pick him up, and throw him out into the darkness, the darkness further out. There will be the crying and the grinding of the teeth there.'
You see, many are invited, but few are select."
At that time, after the Separatists traveled away, they received counsel on how they might trap Him in an answer.

And they are sending their students out to Him with the Herod supporters, saying, "Teacher, we realize that You are truthful, You teach the way of God in truth, and there is no concern in You about anyone. You see, You do not look at people's appearance.
So tell us, what does it seem to you? Is it permitted to give an enrollment tax to Caesar or not?"
But when Jesus knew their evilness, He said, "Why are you trying to cause trouble with Me, fakers?
Show Me the legal tender of the enrollment." The people brought Him a denarius (a fifty-dollar coin).
And He says to them, "Whose image and inscription is it?"
They say to Him, "Caesar's." Then He says to them, "So give the things of Caesar back to Caesar, and the things of God back to God."
And when they heard this, they were amazed. And after they left Him, they went away.
During that day, Sadducees (who say there is to be no return back to life) came to Him and asked Him,
saying, "Teacher, Moses said, 'If anyone dies not having children, his brother will also marry his wife and stand up a seed for his brother.'
There were seven brothers beside us, and after the first married, he passed away. And not having a seed, he left his wife to his brother,
likewise also the second and the third until the seven brothers passed away.
Later the wife of them all also died.
So in the return back to life, whose wife will she be of the seven? You see, they all had her."
When Jesus answered, He said to them, "You are misled, not knowing the Old Testament writings nor the ability of God.
You see, in the return back to life, neither do they marry, nor are they given out in marriage, but they are as God's angels in heaven.
But about the return back to life of the dead, didn't you read what was stated to you by God (in Exodus 3:6 and 15) that says,
'I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?' God is not the God of dead people, but of living."
And when the crowds heard this, they were being impressed based on His teaching.
When the Separatists heard that He quieted the Sadducees, they were gathered together based on the same thing.
And one from among them, a law expert, asked, trying to cause Him trouble and saying,
"Teacher, which demand is the great demand in the law?"
Jesus said to him, "'You will love the Master, your God, with your whole heart, with your whole soul, and with your whole mind.'
This is the first and great demand.
The second is like it, 'You will love the person near you as yourself.'
In these two demands are hung the whole Law and the Preachers."
Since the Separatists had been gathered together, Jesus asked them,
saying, "What does it seem to you concerning the Anointed King? Whose son is he?" They say to him, "David's."
He says to them, "So how does David in the Spirit call him Master, saying, (in Psalm 110:1)
'The Master said to my Master, Sit down at places to the right of Me until I place Your enemies as a footrest of Your feet?'
So if David calls Him Master, how is He his son?"
And no one was able to answer Him a word, neither did anyone dare to ask Him anymore after that day.
